div.p: DX19 Cotton/Story Papers, University of Tasmania Archives, Hobart.
MS annotation by Story: 'Specr[...] Zannichellia Palestris is it found at Ravensdale'. Melbourne

Allow me to ask you, dear Dr Story, whether you can furnish me in a letter with a few good specimens having anthers and ripe fruit of the enclosed Althenia, described as Zannichellia palestris — so it seems — in the Flora Tasmanica. The piece of the plant enclosed is from West Australia, but a small fragment of apparently the same species adheres to some other water plants sent by you.

The plant is most likely common in ditches near you[.]
editorial addition.
I am now finally working on Najadeae for the Flora (the 7th volume). There ought to be yet other Lemnae near you then L. minor and L. trisulca.
Let me hope you are well. That is the sincere wish of your regardful friend
